result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Holtz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation ordered as to count two.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

To commence no later than 12:00 p.m. on 10/23/2015.
Huber/release privileges for employment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING in BR. 7 on July 18, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

miscConds.notes: $293.60 to the  Crime Victim Compensation Fund.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No Contact Order with S.D.H.
AS TO COUNT TWO:  Court grants motion for expungement and will allow count two to be expunged after successful completion of the sentence.

Sex offender evaluation.  Compy with any recomended treatment.
Attend probation review hearing in BR. 7.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Holtz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agent Gretchn Burg appeared. The court does not order sex offender registry.
The court grants the defendant release for elder care.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. jbs
motion for elder care release. tf
Bail Refund Packets
Count two.
Count one.
Count two.

Telephone call received from Atty. C. Cherella requesting that bail monies posted as to this case be applied to restitution and costs owing.
Court will grant request.

SENTENCING ENTRY TO BE AMENDED AS FOLLOWS:
Cash bail posted on this case to be applied to restitution and costs owing.  Any remaining balance to be returned to the remittur.

All other terms of the sentencing to remain as previously entered into the CCAP record.

Defense counsel motion as to expungement:
As to Count 2 - Court grants motion and will allow Count 2 to be expunged after successful completion of the sentence

As to Count 1 - denied by the Court
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds.   State advises the Court they have complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve  6  months at the House of Correction with Huber/release privileges for employment and 5 (five) days credit.  Sentence to commence no later than 12:00 p.m. on 10-23-2015.
Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation ordered as to Count 2.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve  9  months at the House of Correction.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  2 years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Sex Offender evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- No Contact Order with S.D.H.
- Court sets Restitution at $293.60
- Pay Restitution in the amount of $293.60 to the Crime Victim Compensation Fund
- Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Attend the probation review hearing in Branch 7.

Defense counsel motion for defendant to not register as a sex offender; Court will defer ruling until the probation review hearing.

Appeal rights given.  
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case passed until 1:30 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court (via telephone).  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel in in trial in another county. Per Judge McAdams this case can be adjourned off the record. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella (via telephone.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared (via telephone) for the State of Wisconsin.
The court is in trial and defense counsel would like for this case to remain before this court for sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defense counsel contacted the court to adjourn sentencing as the court is in trial and counsel wants this case to remain before this court. The court approves this request.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report, received and filed.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-16-2015 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
received from Crystal Holtz, Jacob Holtz, Tyler Ross, Emmy Goetsch, Pam Beres, Michael Riddle, Marissa Fritz, Hannah Holtz, Dan & Sandra Holtz, Anthony Placanica and Gina Holtz.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report, received and filed.  Court takes no action.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report, received and filed.  Court takes no action.
Justice Point Violation Report - Positive Drug Test - received and filed. Defendant has a valid prescription. Court took no further action. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Arguments heard from defense counsel to modify the no contact order. State does not object. Court granted defense motion and removed the following people from the No Contact Order: Justin P., Ryley W., and Nathan G. All other conditions of bail remain in effect.

Plea hearing proceeded. State placed negotiations on the record. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 AMENDED & COUNT 2 -
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.

Court advised the defendant of the sex offender registry requirements. 
Court vacated the jury trial date of 9/14/15. Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams,  Branch 07, Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.

COUNT 2 remains the same.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Violation Report - positive drug test - received and filed. Defendant has a valid prescription. Court took no further action. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for motion hearing. Defense still wishes to proceed with a Daubert Hearing as it pertains to the nurse's report. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, the witness was not subpoenaed for today's proceedings. Defense withdrew their motion for a Daubert Hearing as it pertains to expert testimony on the DNA evidence. Court ordered the State to submit in writing a page of the potential DNA expert's credentials. Court ordered the parties to determine on their own if the witness testifying to the DNA report needs to attend the Daubert hearing to be held on the next scheduled court date. Court discussed pretrial filings. Court ordered the defense to file any responses by  06/22/2015. Court ordered the State to file a proposed redaction of the Wisconsin State Crime Lab Report along with a proposal of how to address the potential witness.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 09/14/2015. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing and decision scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
State's brief in response to defense supplemental pretrial motion received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Subpoenas (9) issued by attorney Cherella received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Case recalled. Appearance remain the same. ADA Davis is in trial in Branch 10. Court ordered this matter adjourned. Court amonished defense witnesses Nathan G., Justin P., Ryley W. to comply with defense counsel's subpoena and to appear at the next court date. Defense counsel requests a bail hearing date be set. Parties advised as of 8/01/15 this case will be assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7 in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Motion hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Arguments heard as to the DNA reports. Court will defer ruling on defense counsel's motion to exclude the DNA evidence. Court passed to address court calendar. Parties to return at 11:20 a.m. to determine the status of this case.
Supplemental Pretrial Motion filed by attorney Cherella received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Motion for Hearing into Admissibility of Expert Testimony; or, in the alternative, to exclude expert testimony with attached cover letter received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Notice of Expert Testimony and DNA Evidence with attached CV of SANE Nurse Alison Lopez received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Proposed Verdict Forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter from ADA Davis with attached substantive jury instruction for COUNT 2 and proposed stipulation received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Transcript of defendant's statements submitted by attorney Cherella received and filed. Per Court, this document is not file-stamped in the event it is published to the jury. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Supplemental Witness List recieved and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel has completed a transcript of the defendant's statements and requests it be published to the jury. Court finds the State has waived any objection and will allow the transcript to be published to the jury. Arguments heard as to defense motion to sever. Court DENIED defense motion for reasons stated on the record. Defense counsel will prepare a stipulation based on the Court's ruling. State to file witness list be close of business today. Parties advise the Court no offer has been made to the defense for reasons stated on the record. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 5/18/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point violation - Positive Drug Test - received and filed. Defendant has a valid prescription. Court took no action. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Erin M. Karshen on behalf of Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel withdrew motion to challenge the admissibility of the defendant's statements. Discussion regarding transcript of the defendant's statements. Court will not require the State to produce a transcript. Court will rule on defense counsel's motion to sever at the next court date. State requests an additional final pretrial date. Court grants State's request. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 5/18/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Proposed List of Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Proposed Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Motion in Limine submitted by the defense received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter to the Court from ADA Davis received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Violation Report - positive drug test - received and filed. Defendant has a valid prescription. Court took no further action.

Defense counsel contacted the court requesting a short adjournment of the final pretrial date due to scheduling unavailability. State notified and does not object. Court granted defense request. Final Pretrial rescheduled to 05/01/15 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Certified Bail/Bond Records from Waukesha County case 14CM1479, received and filed.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Hearing. Discussions of Justice Point Violation Report placed on the record. Defense provided the court with a Doctor's excuse. State requests no action be taken. Court admonished the defendant and ordered him to provide updated prescriptions to Justice Point and to follow all conditions of bail. Court still needs to rule on defense motion to suppress and motion to severe. Discussion regarding DVD of defendants video recorded statements to the police. State advises the Court the file is corrupt. Court ordered the officer be present at the next court date for testimony as to the corrupt file. State to submit letter to defense counsel with further explanation of the file by 4/20/2015. Defense counsel's response due by 4/27/2015. Case remains set for Final Pretrial on 4/30/2015 and Jury Trial on 5/18/2015. Case adjourned to branch 25.
Received and Filed, Work excuse on behalf of defendant.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Received and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Telephone contact. Court ordered matter set on calendar for Hearing. Parties notified. Case adjourned to branch 25 on 4/2/2015 at 11:00am.
Received and Filed, Motion to Sever Bail Jumping Charge.
Received and Filed, Motion to Suppress Statements.
Justice Point violation report - positive drug test - received and filed. Defendant has now given Justice Point a valid prescription. Court took no action on the violation. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Court reviewed the No Contact Order with the parties. Court ordered a condition of bail be added that the defendant is prohibited from maintaining any social media accounts.

Parties advise the court the arraignment has not yet been completed. Original Information previously filed on 2/05/15. Defense counsel waived formal reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense has not received an offer from the State and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.   Parties to file motions by 03/19/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Defense counsel may file a Miranda motion. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Michael Thurston on behalf of Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Additional arguments heard as to defense motion to dismiss. Court DENIED defense motion for reasons stated on the record.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
State's Brief in Response to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss (Insufficient Preliminary Examination) received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point violation report - positive drug test - received and filed. Court will not take any action. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Motion to Dismiss - Insufficient Preliminary Examination received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Clerk received a call from Justice Point following court proceedings today indicating the defendant had positive drug test results. After the drug test Justice Point informed the Court they now have a written valid prescription to account for the positive drug test. The Court will not take action on this violation. ADA Davis and attorney Cherella notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Michael Thurston on behalf of Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment. Defense counsel has filed a motion to dismiss. State and the Court need additional time to review the preliminary hearing transcript as it has not been filed in the court file yet. Defense does not object to an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING (29 pages) commencing 02/05/2015 received and filed. mt

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella who appeared via telephone.  Kevin Shomin on behalf of Cindy Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 25. Branch 25 is down and unable to hear the violation report. Justice Point caseworker also in court. Court reviewed violation report with the parties. Court ordered defendant to provide a written copy of his prescription to Justice Point. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case remains scheduled for Arraignment on 2/19/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
Justice Point violation report - positive breathalyzer test - received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defense request to remove breathalyzer test is argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Kevin Shomin for Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense motion to dismiss the criminal complaint is reviewed and denied by the Court at this time.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Keith Miller-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/4/15.

Defendant Andrew J Holtz in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.

Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilt as to Misdemeanor Count (2).
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
